com.srch2.android.http.service

Class Indexable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.srch2.android.http.service.Indexable

  • public abstract class Indexable
extends Object
    Represents an index in the SRCH2 search server. For every index to be searched on, users of the SRCH2 Android SDK should implement a separate subclass of this class to at least define a IndexDescription that will be used by the SRCH2Engine to generate the necessary configuration for the index for the SRCH2 search server.

    Each Indexable implementation must at least override the abstract method public IndexDescription getIndexDescription() in order to define the name and schema of the index the Indexable is supposed to represent.

    This class contains methods for performing CRUD actions on the index such as insertion and searching; however, these same methods can be called statically from the SRCH2Engine by supplying the name of the index as it is defined in the IndexDescription returned from the method getIndexDescription().

    • Method Detail

      • getIndexDescription

        public abstract IndexDescription getIndexDescription()
        User need to implement this method to define what inside this Index.
        Returns:
        the Description of this Index

      • insert

        public void insert(org.json.JSONObject record)
        Inserts the specified JSONObject record into the index that this Indexable represents. This JSONObject should be properly formed and its keys should only consist of the fields as defined in the index's schema; the values of these keys should match the type defined in the index's schema as well.

        After the SRCH2 search server completes the insertion task, the callback method of the StateResponseListener onInsertRequestComplete(String indexName, InsertResponse response) will be triggered containing the status of the completed insertion task.
        Parameters:
        record - the JSONObject representing the record to insert

      • insert

        public void insert(org.json.JSONArray records)
        Inserts the set of records represented as JSONObjects contained in the specified JSONArray records. Each JSONObject should be properly formed and its keys should only consist of the fields as defined in the index's schema; the values of these keys should match the type defined in the index's schema as well. The JSONArray records should also be properly formed and contain only the set of JSONObects that represent the records to be inserted.

        After the SRCH2 search server completes the insertion task, the callback method of the StateResponseListener onInsertRequestComplete(String indexName, InsertResponse response) will be triggered containing the status of the completed insertion task.
        Parameters:
        records - the JSONArray containing the set of JSONObjects representing the records to insert

      • update

        public void update(org.json.JSONObject record)
        Updates the specified JSONObject record into the index that this Indexable represents. This JSONObject should be properly formed and its keys should only consist of the fields as defined in the index's schema; the values of these keys should match the type defined in the index's schema as well. If the primary key supplied in the record does not match the primary key of any existing record, the record will be inserted.

        After the SRCH2 search server completes the update task, the callback method of the StateResponseListener onUpdateRequestComplete(String indexName, UpdateResponse response) will be triggered containing the status of the completed update task.
        Parameters:
        record - the JSONObject representing the record to upsert

      • update

        public void update(org.json.JSONArray records)
        Updates the set of records represented as JSONObjects contained in the specified JSONArray records. Each JSONObject should be properly formed and its keys should only consist of the fields as defined in the index's schema; the values of these keys should match the type defined in the index's schema as well. The JSONArray records should also be properly formed and contain only the set of JSONObects that represent the records to be updates. If the primary key of any of the supplied records in the JSONArray does not match the primary key of any existing record, that record will be inserted.

        After the SRCH2 search server completes the update task, the callback method of the StateResponseListener onUpdateRequestComplete(String indexName, UpdateResponse response) will be triggered containing the status of the completed update task.
        Parameters:
        records - the JSONArray containing the set of JSONObjects representing the records to upsert >>>>>>> ba89e5425625694a42fe88b4a728f180697479a7

      • delete

        public void delete(String primaryKeyOfRecordToDelete)
        <<<<<<< HEAD Delete the record using the record id, or a list of ids.
        Parameters:
        id - the primary key of the record ======= Deletes from the index this Indexable represents the record with a primary key matching the value of the primaryKeyOfRecordToDelete. If no record with a matching primary key is found, the index will remain as it is.

        After the SRCH2 search server completes the deletion task, the callback method of the StateResponseListener onDeleteRequestComplete(String indexName, DeleteResponse response) will be triggered containing the status of the completed deletion task.
        primaryKeyOfRecordToDelete - the primary key of the record to delete >>>>>>> ba89e5425625694a42fe88b4a728f180697479a7

      • info

        public void info()
        <<<<<<< HEAD Get the information from the Index ======= Performs an information task on the index that this Indexable represents. This method may be used to inspect the state of the index such as the number of records in the index by calling getNumberOfDocumentsInTheIndex() on the resulting InfoResponse.

        When the SRCH2 search server completes the information task, the method void onInfoRequestComplete(final String indexName, final InfoResponse response) will be triggered. The InfoResponse response will contain information about the index such as the number of records it contains or the time stamp of the last time the index was updated to reflect any pending changes. >>>>>>> ba89e5425625694a42fe88b4a728f180697479a7

      • search

        public void search(String searchInput)
        <<<<<<< HEAD Do a basic search on the current indexInternal. The queryString contains the space will be split and searched using the multiple keywords. All query keywords will be treated all as fuzzy matching, and the last keyword will be treated as fuzzy and prefix matching. For the more specific setting on the terms, please use advancedSearch(Query) } method.
        Parameters:
        searchInput - the string input ======= Does a basic search on the index that this Indexable represents. A basic search means that all distinct keywords (delimited by white space) of the searchInput are treated as fuzzy, and the last keyword will be treated as fuzzy and prefix.

        For more configurable searches, use the Query class in conjunction with the advancedSearch(Query query) method.

        When the SRCH2 server is finished performing the search task, the method onNewSearchResultsAvailable(int HTTPResponseCode, String jsonResultsLiteral, HashMap> resultRecordMap) will be triggered. The resultRecordMap will contain the search results in the form of JSONObjects as they were originally inserted (and updated).

        This method will throw an exception is the value of searchInput is null or has a length less than one.
        searchInput - the textual input to search on

      • advancedSearch

        public void advancedSearch(Query query)
        Does an advanced search by forming search request input as a Query. This enables searches to use all the advanced features of the SRCH2 search engine, such as per term fuzziness similarity thresholds, limiting the range of results to a refining field, and much more. See the Query for more details.

        When the SRCH2 server is finished performing the search task, the method onNewSearchResultsAvailable(int HTTPResponseCode, String jsonResultsLiteral, HashMap> resultRecordMap) will be triggered. The resultRecordMap will contain the search results in the form of JSONObjects as they were originally inserted (and updated).

        This method will throw an exception if the value of query is null.
        Parameters:
        query - the formation of the query to do the advanced search

      • getRecordbyID

        public void getRecordbyID(String primaryKeyOfRecordToRetrieve)
        Retrieves a record from the index this Indexable represents if the primary key of any record in the index matches the value of primaryKeyOfRecordToRetrieve. When the SRCH2 search server completes the retrieval task, the method onGetRecordByIDComplete(final String indexName, final GetRecordResponse response) of the StateResponseListener will be triggered. The record retrieved will be in the form of a JSONObject inside the response GetRecordResponse.

        This method will than an IllegalArgumentExceptionif the value of primaryKeyOfRecordToRetrieve is null or has a length less than one.
        Parameters:
        primaryKeyOfRecordToRetrieve - the primary key
